Core Matchers
[Matcher Library]

Fundamental matchers of objects and values, and composite matchers. More...

Detailed Description

Fundamental matchers of objects and values, and composite matchers.

Define Documentation

#define allOf   HC_allOf

allOf(matcher1, ...) - Evaluates to YES only if all of the given matchers evaluate to YES.

Synonym for HC_allOf, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

Parameters:
matcher1 Comma-separated list of matchers ending with nil.
See also:
HCAllOf
#define anyOf   HC_anyOf

anyOf(matcher1, ...) - Evaluates to YES if any of the given matchers evaluate to YES.

Synonym for HC_anyOf, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

Parameters:
matcher1 Comma-separated list of matchers ending with nil.
See also:
HCAnyOf
#define anything (  )     HC_anything()

This matcher always evaluates to YES.

Synonym for HC_anything, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsAnything
#define anythingWithDescription   HC_anythingWithDescription

anythingWithDescription(description) - This matcher always evaluates to YES.

Synonym for HC_anythingWithDescription, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

Parameters:
aDescription A meaningful string used when describing itself.
See also:
HCIsAnything
#define describedAs   HC_describedAs

describedAs(description, matcher, ...) - Wraps an existing matcher and overrides the description when it fails.

Optional values following the matcher are substituted for %0, %1, etc., in the description. The last argument must be nil.

Synonym for HC_describedAs, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCDescribedAs
#define equalTo   HC_equalTo

equalTo(object) - Is the object equal to another object, as tested by the -isEqual: method?

If the given object is nil, the matcher will match nil.

Synonym for HC_equalTo, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsEqual
#define instanceOf   HC_instanceOf

instanceOf(type) - Is the value an instance of a particular type?

Synonym for HC_instanceOf, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsInstanceOf
#define is   HC_is

is(matcherOrValue) - Decorates another matcher, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used is(equalTo(x)).

If matcherOrValue is a matcher, its behavior is retained, but the test may be more expressive.

If matcherOrValue is not a matcher, it is wrapped in an equalTo matcher. This makes the following three statements the same: 

assertThat(cheese, equalTo(smelly))
assertThat(cheese, is(equalTo(smelly)))
assertThat(cheese, is(smelly))

Choose the style that makes your expression most readable. This will vary depending on context.

Synonym for HC_is, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIs
#define isNot   HC_isNot

isNot(matcherOrValue) - Inverts the rule, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used isNot(equalTo(x)).

For example: 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(equalTo(smelly)))

vs. 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(smelly))

Synonym for HC_isNot, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsNot
#define nilValue (  )     HC_nilValue()

Matches if the value is nil.

Synonym for HC_nilValue, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsNil

Synonym for HC_notNilValue, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsNil
HCIsNot
#define sameInstance   HC_sameInstance

sameInstance(object) - Evaluates to YES only when the argument is this same object.

Synonym for HC_sameInstance, available if HC_SHORTHAND is defined.

See also:
HCIsSame

If the given object is nil, the matcher will match nil.

id<HCMatcher> HC_is ( id  matcherOrValue  ) 

Decorates another matcher, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used is(equalTo(x)).

If matcherOrValue is a matcher, its behavior is retained, but the test may be more expressive.

If matcherOrValue is not a matcher, it is wrapped in an equalTo matcher. This makes the following three statements the same: 

assertThat(cheese, equalTo(smelly))
assertThat(cheese, is(equalTo(smelly)))
assertThat(cheese, is(smelly))

Choose the style that makes your expression most readable. This will vary depending on context.

Synonym: is

See also:
HCIs
id<HCMatcher> HC_isNot ( id  matcherOrValue  ) 

Inverts the rule, or provides a shortcut to the frequently used isNot(equalTo(x)).

For example: 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(equalTo(smelly)))

vs. 

assertThat(cheese, isNot(smelly))

Synonym: isNot
